title: Between 1 July 2017 and 30 June 2018, will an armed group from Myanmar engage in a campaign that systematically kills 1,000 or more civilians in Myanmar?
preds: Still think issues with counting and classifying will predominate in the resolution of this question, but seems to me that the on-going campaign includes forced relocation.

I dont't expect this to escalate further. It's hard to access the death toll of the clearance operations that have been halted since the beginning of September. It is def. somewhere above 400, but I doubt that it surpasses 1000. As I can't be certain of that, I'll give this 25%.

Raising to 50%, waiting for Aung San Suu Kyi big speech. I spoke with Germans in Myanmar yesterday, the rally around the flag effect is immense and people in Myanmar don't pay too much attention to how this issue is being reported on outside their country. While Aung San Suu Kyi obv. will adress this issue in her speech, she will prob. continue to focus on other conflicts in Myanmar nontheless as also the population doesn't care too much about the fate of the Rohingya. I assume she will frame this issue as one of outside militias vs. the state of Myanmar against which people will have to unify. There are a lot of fake news out there (from both sides) and most people inside Myanmar probably believe that fleeing Rohingyas burned down their houses themselves to be able to accuse the government of ethnic cleansing and damage it's reputation. There are some video campaigns suggesting exactly that (although they are flawed as videos allegedly displaying residents burning down their own houses show the same man in multiply villages etc.). Meaning: There are militias in civilian clothing perpetrating atrocities & as the situation is developing right now, it is highly unlikely that the perpetrators will be held accountable. If clearance operation continue, it can therefore be assumed that the death toll will continue to rise.
Based on general news and GJP consensus.

In my copious free time I wonder whether folks must die within in Myanmar if they wish to be counted, or can they contribute to the total if they flee Myanmar and then die in Bangladesh of wounds or starvation or disease.  The deaths of the latter group are surely down to a discrete campaign by the Myamar military--but who knows how the scorers will deal with such matters?

Myanmar army still claims only targeting insurgents, but ... awful lot of people on the move.  Lots of houses burnt.  Documentation & # of deaths intentionally caused are weak points. More than 1000 dead plausible, but some will be due to conditions.
